meanings.definition: To withdraw or disavow a statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: She had to recant her earlier claim about seeing a ghost.
meanings.sent2: He decided to recant his support for the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to recant his trick after it went wrong.
meanings.sent4: The politician had to recant his promises when he couldn't deliver.
meanings.sent5: The student had to recant his excuse for not doing the homework.

meanings.sent1: The witness was forced to recant his testimony in court.
meanings.sent2: After further investigation, the scientist had to recant his hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to recant his claim that his dish was the best in town.
meanings.sent4: The athlete had to recant his statement about retiring early.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to recant her grading mistake to the students.
